channel.title: Concatenate on Andrew Gillock
channel.description: Recent content in Concatenate on Andrew Gillock

item.title: R versus Python
item.description: Python has proven to be quite useful, but especially in saving time with functions not available in R. An example can be seen below: #in R first <- "and" last <- "rew" #concatenate paste(first, last, sep = "", collapse = NULL) ## [1] "andrew" #in python first = "and" last = "rew" #concatenate first + last ## 'andrew' Despite performing the same operation and displaying the same output, Python can be faster than R in certain situations.
